Key Match Events: Rashid Khan hit sixes in the 17th and 18th overs to bring Afghanistan's chances up to 6.5%
Rashid Khan hit a six over deep midwicket in the 18th over
Rashid Khan hit a six over long-off in the 18th over
Rashid Khan hit a six over deep square in the 19th over
Rashid Khan hit a four over long leg in the 19th over
Rashid Khan hit a four over the leg side in the 19th over
Darwish Rasooli was run out by Matthew Wade and Marcus Stoinis in the 19th over
Glenn Maxwell was awarded the Player of the Match award
Pre-Game Insights: Matthew Wade mentioned that Australia will stay in Adelaide and watch the England vs Sri Lanka game, hoping for an upset
Matthew Wade said that Australia put themselves in a difficult situation by not boosting their NRR
Matthew Wade mentioned that David Warner and Aaron Finch's fitness is a concern, but they are hopeful they will be fit for the semi-finals
Post-Match Reflections: Matthew Wade said that Australia's failure to boost their NRR has left them on their last prayer as defending T20 World Cup champions
Matthew Wade mentioned that Afghanistan's chances of winning were slim, but they played well and executed their plans
Glenn Maxwell said that Afghanistan played well and struck the ball cleanly, but Australia couldn't get away with the required runs
Glenn Maxwell mentioned that he was happy to have an impact in the field and that the wicket was quite slow during the day
Glenn Maxwell said that Afghanistan's run-out in the 19th over was a turning point in the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia won the match by 4 runs
Afghanistan's chances of winning were up to 6.5% on Forecaster
England's destiny in the tournament is in their own hands, and they can qualify for the semi-finals with a win against Sri Lanka
Australia's NRR is a concern, and they need to win the match against Sri Lanka to boost their chances
Others: Rashid Khan was awarded the CRICINFO MVP award with 110.2 points
Naveen-ul-Haq was awarded the CRICINFO MVP award with 89.73 points
Adam Zampa was awarded the CRICINFO MVP award with 74.64 points
Josh Hazlewood was awarded the CRICINFO MVP award with 61.05 points
